title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.37 | 06-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjari Shalakaya
Chaksharon Meelitam Yena Dasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namao Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Dityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravata Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 37th
verse of the 8th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti
The meaning of this verse is
O my Lord, you have executed all duties yourself
Are you leaving us?
Today though we are completely dependent on your mercy
And have no one else to protect us
Now when all kings are at enmity with us
This verse spoken by Kunti Devi in a prayer to Krishna
Is clearly indicating the position of a pure devotee like Kunti Devi
On the Supreme Lord Krishna
In a sense what is Kunti Devi telling?
My dear Lord Krishna, we are dependent on you.
We are totally dependent on your mercy.
We have no one else for protecting us.
Only you are our protector.
This is the factual position of everyone, not only Kunti Devi.
But pure devotees know this, recognize this and always take shelter of Krishna.
The non-devotees, they try to take shelter of so many other so-called shelters.
But they are not.
They are not.
They are not.
They are not.
They are not.
They are not.
But nobody else can protect us, the living beings, except Krishna.
Only Krishna can protect us.
Because non-devotee means somebody who is in a very unsafe position.
Under the clutches of the illusory energy.
It is not at all safe.
It is not at all secure.
It is not at all the best shelter.
It is not.
So Sri Lama Prabhupada explains in the bird-port to this verse.
The Pandavas are most fortunate because with all good luck, they were entirely dependent
on the mercy of the Lord.
In the material world, to be dependent on the mercy of someone else is the utmost sign
of misfortune.
See, in the material world, people want to be independent.
That's the material disease.
What is the material disease?
To be independent of Krishna.
Because our constitutional position is dependence on Krishna.
And by becoming dependent on Krishna, not by becoming, by remaining dependent on
Krishna, we are completely independent of all other persons, all other so-called sources
of protection.
But in the case of our transcendental relation with the Lord, it is the most fortunate case
where we can live completely dependent on Krishna.
The material disease is due to thinking of becoming independent of everything.
This is the material disease.
I want to be independent.
But a cruel material nature does not allow us to become independent.
The false attempt to become independent of the stringent laws of nature is known as material
knowledge material advancement means we go on trying to secure ourselves
whenever we face some danger and what is the nature was material existence danger
in every step padam padamyati padam that is material existence and only a foolish
man will think that I can secure myself independently you cannot material
nature is going to completely smash all our so-called arrangements the whole
material world is moving on this false attempt at becoming independent of the
laws of nature beginning from Ravana
Ravana lived millions and millions of years back in some Dretayuga
former age this Ravana he wanted to prepare a direct staircase to the
plants of heaven and transport people against the laws of God what are the
laws of God that anybody wants to elevate themselves like we've энергized
performing
pious activities and qualify themselves to go there impious persons cannot force themselves
or somehow go there it's not possible so ramana thought why should people perform pious activities
i will make a staircase to heaven from the earth and anybody wants to go even without
performing any austerity they can go i will give them the access this is what ramana thought
but that is never to happen
so srila prabhupada says beginning from ravana down to the present age they are trying to
overcome the laws of nature they are trying now to approach distant planetary systems by
electronic mechanical power just like they're trying to go to the moon
but they cannot force themselves the way they are attempting
the highest goal of human civilization is to work hard under the guidance of the supreme lord krishna
and become completely dependent on him the highest achievement of perfect civilization
is to work with valor but at the same time depend completely on the supreme lord krishna
this is the best achievement the part of us were the ideal existence
of this standard of civilization because they're pure devotees and they rule the whole world
teaching people this principle what are the principle the pandavas were teaching
completely depend on the supreme lord krishna and you are safe you're secure
that is the way to
make spiritual progress and go back to godhead that is the way
undoubtedly the pandavas were completely dependent on the goodwill of lord sri krishna
but they were not idle parasites of the lord this is a very important point
pandavas are dependent on the goodwill of the supreme lord krishna does not mean
that krishna will do everything i don't have to do anything no they are not idle parasites
they were all highly qualified both by personal character and their physical activities
they were in terms of character they had the best character as is very evident in the dealings of
the part of us with everyone else and they were also active physically also not sitting back lazily
and telling krishna we'll do it
still they always look for the mercy of the Lord
because they knew that every living being is dependent
by constitutional position
the way we are made
the way we are
we depend completely on the Supreme God
the perfection of life is therefore
to become dependent on the will of the Lord
instead of becoming falsely independent in the material world
somebody may say I am an independent person
in the material world
but that person is speaking
in ignorance
under illusions somebody may think
everything is fine with me now
that is because
after the previous misery that somebody
has

then they get some relief from that misery
they think everything is fine
but very soon
another misery is going to affect them
miseries come one after another
one after another
one after another
there is some relief
period between two miseries
and that period people wrongly think
because wrongly think
because wrongly think
because wrongly think
Right now, I've got some relief, some misery, I was suffering, therefore I think everything is fine.
I have become so habituated to suffering in this world that when I get relief, I think it's very nice.
Those who try to become falsely independent of the Lord
are called anatha or without any guardian, anatha.
Whereas those who are completely dependent on the will of the Lord are called sanatha
or those having someone to protect them.
Therefore, we must try to be sanatha so that we can always be protected from the
unfavorable condition of material existence.
As long as we are here,
in the material world, we need protection
against the onslaught of maya and how is that protection to be
achieved? By becoming dependent on Krishna
through devotional service.
By the deluding power of the external material
nature, we forget that material condition of life is the most
undesirable perplexity.
That's the power of maya.
As I said, when there is some relief from some suffering, we think under the influence
of illusion, I am very safe.
I am protected or I am fine.
I don't require any protection.
That's what I think.
The Bhagavad Gita, 7th chapter, 19th verse,
therefore, directs us that after many, many births, one fortunate person becomes
aware of the fact that Vasudeva or Krishna is all in all and that the best way of
leading one's life is to surrender unto him completely.
bahunam janmanamante jnanavan mam prapadyate
jnanavan means one person.
Got mature knowledge.
Fully enlightened by properly maturing in transcendental knowledge.
Such a person is actually a Mahatma.
Mahatma means a pure devotee.
All the members of the Pandava family were Mahatmas
in household life.
They were not renunciates.
They were not renunciates.
They were not renunciates.
They were not renunciates.
They were not living in a secluded place doing some meditation or
tapasya.
They were householders.
They had responsible duties as Kshatriyas.
Maharaj Yudhishthira was the head of these Mahatmas,
as Pandavas.
And Queen Kunti Devi was the mother.
The lessons of the Bhagavad Gita and all the Puranas,
specifically the Bhagavata Puranas or Srimad Bhagavatam,
are therefore inevitably connected with the history of the Pandava Mahatmas.
The scriptures are teaching us that we should depend upon the Supreme Lord.
That's what the scriptures are teaching us.
And that is best illustrated by this description of the Pandavas' dependence on Krishna.
For the Pandavas, separately, they were dependent on Krishna.
For the Pandavas, separation from the Lord was just like separation of the fish from water.
The fish cannot live outside of water.
Similarly, devotees cannot live outside of the protection of Krishna.
So Queen Kunti is pursuing the Lord.
Please stay with us.
Don't go home.
Because we are totally dependent on you.
So I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Thank you.
